com.stormpath.sdk.tenant

Interface Tenant

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Extendable, Resource, Saveable, TenantActions

    public interface Tenant
extends Resource, Saveable, TenantActions, Extendable
    A Tenant represents a customer's private data 'space' within Stormpath that contains all of the customer's Stormpath-stored resources, like Applications, Directories, Accounts and Groups.

    TenantActions

    Additionally, while this Tenant interface represents the actual Tenant resource, many tenant behaviors/actions are defined in the parent TenantActions interface. TenantActions is implemented by both the Tenant implementation and the Client. This is a convenience where common tenant-wide actions may be performed directly via the Client instance. For example: 

     ApplicationList myApplications = client.getApplications();
    instead of forcing you to make an intermediate getCurrentTenant() call: 
     ApplicationList myApplications = client.getCurrentTenant().getApplications();
    which can sometimes make for more readable code.

    If you can't find what you're looking for in this interface, be sure to check TenantActions and it will likely be there.

    Since:
    0.1
    See Also:
    TenantActions

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()

        Returns the tenant's globally-unique name in Stormpath.

        THIS CAN CHANGE IN THE FUTURE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier. If you need a permanent ID, use the href as the permanent ID (this is true for all resources, not just Tenant resources).

        Returns:
        the tenant's Stormpath globally-unique name. THIS CAN CHANGE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier.

      • getKey

        String getKey()

        Returns the tenant's globally-unique human-readable key in Stormpath.

        THIS CAN CHANGE IN THE FUTURE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier. If you need a permanent ID, use the href as the permanent ID (this is true for all resources, not just Tenant resources).

        Returns:
        the tenant's Stormpath globally-unique human-readable name key. THIS CAN CHANGE. Do not rely on it as a permanent identifier.

      • saveWithResponseOptions

        Tenant saveWithResponseOptions(TenantOptions responseOptions)
        Saves this Tenant resource and ensures the returned Tenant response reflects the specified options. This enhances performance by 'piggybacking' the response to return related resources you know you will use after saving the tenant.
        Parameters:
        responseOptions - The TenantOptions to use to customize the Tenant resource returned in the save response.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        1.0.RC4.6
